intro: Anthericum ciliolatum, commonly known as the velvet fern, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its dense, low-growing rosettes of lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in racemes, typically blooming in late summer. Its leaves are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a soft, velvety appearance. Anthericum ciliolatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well-suited to rocky or sandy soils.
